SEARCH

Class Animal

java.lang.Object
Animal
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bear, Fish
public abstract class Animal extends Object
Abstract base class representing an animal in the river ecosystem. Each animal has a sex and an age.
Author:
Ali Kablanbek

  • Constructor Details

    • Animal

      public Animal()
      Creates an animal with a random age and sex. Age is bounded by the subclass's maximum age.

    • Animal

      public Animal(int age, Animal.Sex sex)
      Creates an animal with the specified age and sex.
      Parameters:
      age - the age of the animal
      sex - the sex of the animal

  • Method Details

    • getAge

      public int getAge()
      Returns the age of this animal.
      Returns:
      the current age

    • getSex

      public Animal.Sex getSex()
      Returns the sex of this animal.
      Returns:
      the sex

    • maxAge

      abstract boolean maxAge()
      Returns true if the animal's age has reached the maximum for its species.
      Returns:
      true if at max age, false otherwise

    • incrAge

      abstract boolean incrAge()
      If the current age is less than the maximum, increments the age by one and returns true. otherwise, leaves the age unchanged and returns false.
      Returns:
      true if age was incremented, false if already at max

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation such as "BF7" for a 7-year-old female bear. Format: [B/F][F/M][age]
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      string representation of the animal
